entry.title: Operations for Mysql in Linux
entry.content:
1. Install mysql

  2. Start mysql

  1. Add users.

    The value of host:
    %: connect to mysql server from any other machine
    localhost: just local host
    ip_address: specific ip address

  2. Grant authority to users.

    The value of [the_value_of_host]:
    %: connect to mysql server from any other machine
    localhost: just local host
    ip_address: specific ip address

    [all privileges] can be set with specific authority(“select,delete,update,create,drop”)

    [db_name] can be set with all databases(“*”)

    [db_table_name] can be set with all tables(“*”)

  3. Update password.

  1. Delete users.

Attention:
It cannot be active when you forgot to run a command(“flush privileges”).
entry.summary:
1. Install mysql

  2. Start mysql

entry.title: Auto-start Services on Boot in Linux
entry.content:
CentOS6

  1. Show list of services that start on boot.

  1. Add a service to auto-start on boot.

  1. Confirm script is added successfully

  2. Disable an auto-start services.

CentOS7

  1. Add a service to auto-start on boot.

  1. Disable an auto-start service.

  1. Check the status of auto-start service.
entry.summary:
CentOS6

  1. Show list of services that start on boot.

  1. Add a service to auto-start on boot.

entry.title: Attention for Using Markdown code block
entry.content:
When you are using markdown code block, you may meet a strange circumstance that disorder within code blocks. Just like the image blow.


So, when you confront same problem like me, you just need to delete your space symbols after your end of code block. If you put one more space after your code block, the system will not recognize that’s a end signal of code block.
entry.summary: When you are using markdown code block, you may meet a strange circumstance that disorder within code blocks. Just like the image blow.

entry.title: Step by Step Tutorial for Ambari Installation
entry.content:
System Requirements

At first, we need to think about the setups of VMs. So, I list a table for VMs below.

hostnameipoperating systemRAMdisk spacepackage
master1.bigdata.com192.168.110.150centos6.5 64位16g50gambari-server
namenode
slave1.bigdata.com192.168.110.151centos6.5 64位16g50gambari-agent
datanode
slave2.bigdata.com192.168.110.152centos6.5 64位16g50gambari-agent
datanode

VM Deployment

  1. Login VMware vsphere client system
  2. Create 3 VMs with specific system requirements
    1. Set the name of VM
    2. Choose data storage
    3. Choose hardware configuration
    4. Load centos6 ios file into CD-ROM when booting
      You can use minimum version of centos. Then you need to click the option “Running system installation with system booting”.
    5. Configuration complete

  3. Operating system installation

    1. Power on the VM

    2. Choose the first one.

    3. Click “skip” to continue.

    4. Choose language, keyborad and timezone.


    5. Set root password.

    6. Click “Using entire drive” to continue.

    7. Choose “Write changes to disk” to continue.

    8. Reboot.

VM Preparation

1. Configuration and Installation for VMs(master and slave servers)

  1. Install java.

  2. Enable network adapter.

    Then, enable it to run after system booting

  3. Using tool ping to check status of accessing public network and local network.

  4. Change system’s hostname on all servers.

    1. Update file(/etc/sysctl.conf), add a item

    2. Update file(/etc/hosts), add doamins.

    3. Update file(/etc/sysconfig/network)

    4. Reboot systems

    5. Check the correction of hostname

  5. Set up password-less SSH on all servers

    1. Disable SELinux

      Set disabled for SELinux:

    2. Enable access for using public key.
      Warning: File name is sshd_config, not ssh_config.

      Delete comment signal(“#”) blow:

    3. Generate public key and private key on master server.

      Then, click default option for configuration.

    4. Create directories and copy public key to slave servers.

      Login to master server, then copy public key:

      Login to slave server, then copy content from public key to a file(authorized_keys):

  6. Install ntpd on all servers.

    1. Check to see if you have installed ntpd.

    2. If not, install ntpd

  7. Close transparent huge page on all servers.

    1. Append code block to file(/etc/rc.local) for closing transparent huge page.

      code block:

    2. Reboot operating system.

    3. Check the status of transparent huge page to ensure the status is “never”.

2. Set up a local repository on master server.

  1. Install local repository tool.

  2. Install http service.

  3. Start http service.

  4. Install tool wget.

  5. Download ambari & hdp package files to master server.

  6. Copy ambari and hdp packages to http dir, then untar them.

  7. Check repository address for next step.

    Ambari base URL and gpgkey:

    HDP base URL and gpgkey:

    HDP-UTILS base URL and gpgkey(gpgkey file same with HDP gpgkey file):

  8. Copy repository config files.
    ambari repo file:

    hdp repo file:

  9. Update repository config files.
    You ought to renew base URL and gpgkey URL in your ambari.repo and hdp.repo files.

3. Ambari-server setup on master server

  1. Install ambari server

  2. Run command for ambari setup.

  3. If you are not disable the SELinux, you need to press “y”.

  4. If your ambari server under user root, you just need to press “n”.

  5. If you are not disable iptalbes, you need to press “y” to continue.

  6. Select JDK version, then follow steps to install it.

  7. Choose database type
    You can choose embeded database. If you choose mysql, you need to install mysql database on master server and input info for ambari setup. Then put a mysql connector into specific path and run a command below to specify the path of connector.

  8. Run ambari-server

4. Ambari-agent setup on slave servers.

  1. Copy ambari-agent rpm file to slave servers.

  2. Install ambari-agent.

  3. Renew ambari-server URL in config file.

    Renew ambari-server URL below:

  4. Run ambari-agent.

Installation

Before you launch the ambari installation webUI, you ought to ensure things below.

  1. Start the service httpd.
  2. Stop the service iptables.
  3. Start the ambari-server on master server and ambari-agent on slave servers.
    If you want to start quickly, it is advisable to choose default options.
  4. Open your brower, then access to the WebUI and click the item (“Launch Install Wizard”)
    URL: 192.168.110.150:8080
    Account: admin
    Password: admin

  5. Get Started
  6. Select Version
    Choose local repository, then input base URL of HDP and HDP-UTILS.
  7. Install Options
    Input your master’s hostname and slaves’ hostnames. Then copy your master’s ssh private key into item.

  8. Confirm Hosts

    Just click “ok” to continue.

  9. Choose Services
    Choose what service you want to add into your system. You can add new services into your system later on.

    Just click “ok” to continue.

  10. Assign Masters
  11. Assign Slaves and Clients
  12. Customize Services
    You just need to input info for items with red exclamation mark.
  13. Review
  14. Install, Start and Test
    If you get to this step successfully, you can drink a cup of coffee and enjoy this time.
  15. Summary
    So now, say hello world to Ambari.
entry.summary:
System Requirements

At first, we need to think about the setups of VMs. So, I list a table for VMs below.

hostname ip operating system RAM disk space package
master1.bigdata.com 192.168.110.150 centos6.5 64位 16g 50g ambari-server
namenode
slave1.bigdata.com 192.168.110.151 centos6.5 64位 16g 50g ambari-agent
datanode
slave2.bigdata.com 192.168.110.152 centos6.5 64位 16g 50g ambari-agent
datanode

entry.title: Odyssey
entry.content:
It is really a great determination for me to give up comfortable and easy enviroment where I can complete all tasks successfully. Now, I had been to Shanghai for almost one month. And I need to study new development technology and make new friends among this unfamiliar city where I will be surrounded with loneliness.

Nevertheless, I really hope that I can meet all kinds of difficultis which offer me huge experience to upgrade myself. So, I choose to jump out of my comfortable cage and forage challenges. In my opinion, It is a truly tiger that runs above Africa prairie not one in the fancy cage.

Finally, I literally hope that my goal will be hit after one year and start with a more rough journey (Odyssey).
entry.summary: It is really a great determination for me to give up comfortable and easy enviroment where I can complete all tasks successfully. Now, I had been to Shanghai for almost one month. And I need to study new development technology and make new friends among this unfamiliar city where I will be surrounded with loneliness.

entry.title: Some terms in Big Data Ecosystem
entry.content:
• DMP(Data Management Plateform)
    A palteform for collecting and managing data for digital marketing purpose.

  • DSP(Demand-side Plateform)
    A palteform that alows buyers of online advertising to manage ad exchange and pay to buy some adversiting banners according to Real-time bidding.

  • SSP(Supply-side Plateform)
    A palteform that alows web publisher or digital media owner to manage their advertising banners and receive money from this plateform.

  • MDM(Master Data Management)
    A business method that help companies or enterprises to integrate, manage, store critical data in a single point of reference.
    These data can provide for other busniess plateforms or business systems(B2B, B2C, CRM, OMS and etc).
    And master data also are useful for marketing decision and marketing analysis.
    In china, Alibaba announced a business term(“数据中台”) that is based on MDM.
    So, in the next few years, we need to build a digital smart plateform to collect all sources of busniess data that can provide
    information for all kinds of business systems or plateform and bread down obstacles between business systems in companies or enterpises.
entry.summary:
• DMP(Data Management Plateform)
    A palteform for collecting and managing data for digital marketing purpose.

  • DSP(Demand-side Plateform)
    A palteform that alows buyers of online advertising to manage ad exchange and pay to buy some adversiting banners according to Real-time bidding.

  • SSP(Supply-side Plateform)
    A palteform that alows web publisher or digital media owner to manage their advertising banners and receive money from this plateform.

entry.title: [Hexo]Some tricks for using hexo efficiently
entry.content:
change theme

  1. add theme to your hexo (eg. theme next)

  2. update your blog config file(_config.yml, not your theme config file)

add RSS plugin

  1. install RSS tools by npm

  1. update your blog config file(_config.yml, not your theme config file)

  1. update your theme config file(theme/_config.yml)

change the code block theme

record the number of viewers

generate the excerpt

There are two methods for generating excerpt for home page.

  1. update theme config file (theme/next/_config.yml)
    It is not good for you when you are using markdown language because of bad show effect.

  1. add markdown code in your post to control excerpt accurately

add search plugin

  1. install search plugin

  1. update blog config file

  1. update theme config file

add share plugin

  1. get module from github

  2. update theme config file

add google analytics

  1. update theme config file

add reward

  1. update theme config file

generate a permanent post address

  1. install plugin

  1. update blog config file

add comment module (valine)

  1. sign up for a leancloud account

  2. create a application for your comment system

  3. copy AppID and AppKey from your dashboard

  4. paste AppID and AppKey into your theme config file

  1. create classes in your leancloud account to store your data

  2. [not required] you can change your valine lanuage (themes/next/layout/_third-party/comments/valine.swig)

  3. [not required] you can also add white list for security

use image plugin

  1. install “hexo-asset-image” plugin

  1. update your blog config file (_config.yml)

  1. if you use abbrlink plugin to change your permalink attribute in your blog config file, you need to edit this plugin to fit your config (node_modules/hexo-asset-image/index.js). Then you add a code block into this javascript file.

  2. Ok, you can generate your new static html file.

add creative commons module to your blog

It is convenient and useful for bloger to announce your blog copyright announcement. So, you can add this below your posts or add this in your profile information page.

  1. update your theme config file

    # Creative Commons 4.0 International License.# https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/licensing-types-examples# Available values: by | by-nc | by-nc-nd | by-nc-sa | by-nd | by-sa | zerocreative_commons:  license: by-nc-sa  sidebar: true  post: true
entry.summary:
change theme

  1. add theme to your hexo (eg. theme next)

  2. update your blog config file(_config.yml, not your theme config file)

entry.title: [Hexo]Create a blog with hexo in github
entry.content:
1. copy local ssh public key to github

  2. install npm, git

  3. install hexo by npm

  4. init hexo

  1. install other softwares by npm

  2. edit file “_config.yml” and write your git address

  3. install hexo deployment tool

  4. generate static pages by hexo

  5. deploy static pages to github

  6. using local tool to pre-check your blog

  7. access to your github blog
entry.summary:
1. copy local ssh public key to github

  2. install npm, git

  3. install hexo by npm

  4. init hexo
